intro: Rhynchosia holstii, commonly known as the purple burr legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive purple flowers and spiny pods. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Rhynchosia holstii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
